sections.title: üìã Overview
sections.content:
SurfManager is an advanced session and data manager for development tools.

This application provides:
‚Ä¢ Clean interface for data management
‚Ä¢ Session backup and restore functionality
‚Ä¢ Audio feedback system
‚Ä¢ Dark theme optimized for long usage
‚Ä¢ Multi-application support (Windsurf, Cursor, Claude)

sections.title: üîÑ Reset Data
sections.content:
Purpose: Manage application data for Windsurf, Cursor, and Claude.

Features:
‚Ä¢ View application installation paths
‚Ä¢ Quick access to application folders
‚Ä¢ Launch applications directly
‚Ä¢ Reset application data (placeholder)
‚Ä¢ Generate new machine IDs (placeholder)
‚Ä¢ Cleanup build artifacts

Audio Controls:
Toggle audio feedback on/off with the audio button at the bottom of the Actions panel.

sections.title: üë§ Account Manager
sections.content:
Purpose: Create and manage multiple user sessions for different applications.

Session Management:
‚Ä¢ Create backups of current application state
‚Ä¢ Restore previous sessions quickly
‚Ä¢ Switch between different user profiles
‚Ä¢ Rename and organize sessions
‚Ä¢ View session details and sizes

Data Backed Up:
‚Ä¢ User settings and preferences
‚Ä¢ Key bindings and shortcuts
‚Ä¢ Code snippets and templates
‚Ä¢ Workspace configurations
‚Ä¢ Extension settings
‚Ä¢ Authentication data

sections.title: üîä Audio System
sections.content:
Audio Configuration: All audio settings can be customized via app/audio/audio_config.json

Available Sounds:
‚Ä¢ Startup sound when app launches
‚Ä¢ Success sound for completed actions
‚Ä¢ App launch sound
‚Ä¢ Random sounds (optional)

Audio Files: Located in app/audio/sound/
‚Ä¢ startup.ogg - Application startup
‚Ä¢ mambo.mp3 - Success actions
‚Ä¢ akh.mp3 - App launches
‚Ä¢ Plus 4 more random sound effects

Controls: Use the audio toggle button in Reset Data tab to enable/disable all sounds.

sections.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration
sections.content:
Config Files:
‚Ä¢ app/audio/audio_config.json - Audio settings
‚Ä¢ Documents/SurfManager/sessions.json - Session data

Storage Locations:
‚Ä¢ Session backups: Documents/SurfManager/
‚Ä¢ Application data: System default paths

Debug Mode: Launch with debug mode to see detailed logs in the terminal window.

sections.title: üé® Customization
sections.content:
Theme: The application uses a custom dark theme defined in app/gui/styles.py

Audio Customization:
Edit audio_config.json to:
‚Ä¢ Enable/disable specific sounds
‚Ä¢ Adjust volume levels (0.0 - 1.0)
‚Ä¢ Enable random sound effects
‚Ä¢ Change audio file paths

Launcher Options:
‚Ä¢ Normal mode - Hidden terminal
‚Ä¢ Debug mode - Visible terminal with logs

sections.title: üìù Tips & Best Practices
sections.content:
Session Backups:
‚Ä¢ Use descriptive names for easy identification
‚Ä¢ Create backups before major updates
‚Ä¢ Test restore functionality with non-critical sessions
‚Ä¢ Keep backups of different development environments

Performance:
‚Ä¢ Close applications before creating backups
‚Ä¢ Regularly clean up old sessions
‚Ä¢ Use debug mode only when troubleshooting

Audio:
‚Ä¢ Disable audio if it becomes distracting
‚Ä¢ Adjust volume in config file for comfort
‚Ä¢ Random sounds add variety to your workflow

sections.title: üìú Changelog
sections.content:
Version 2.0.0 - Minimal Build Edition (2025-10-25)

Major Optimization:
‚Ä¢ Removed pywin32 dependency (~8 MB saved)
‚Ä¢ Kept pygame for multi-format audio support
‚Ä¢ Only 4 core packages required
‚Ä¢ 30-40% smaller executable size (~60-70 MB)
‚Ä¢ Binary stripping enabled
‚Ä¢ Aggressive module exclusion (20+ modules)

Version 1.5.0 - Optimized Edition

Core Refactoring:
‚Ä¢ Unified build system
‚Ä¢ Singleton pattern for ConfigManager
‚Ä¢ User-defined backup names
‚Ä¢ Fixed Qt6 compatibility issues

Version 1.0.0 - Initial Release

Initial Features:
‚Ä¢ Application detection (Windsurf, Cursor, VS Code, Claude)
‚Ä¢ Reset operations with backup
‚Ä¢ Device ID management
‚Ä¢ PyQt6 modern GUI
‚Ä¢ Audio feedback system
